Keywords Location Search Jobs Discover the Possibilities Home to iconic brands recognized by audiences everywhere for entertainment, inspiration, and innovation, Disney has brought exceptional storytelling and experiences to life for more than 100 years in a way that only we can. Imagine being part of this story. Imagine where a career at Disney can take you! Career Areas Students & Recent Graduates Featured Jobs No jobs were found. View All Jobs OUR LEGACY IN STORIES GLOBAL OPPORTUNITIES The Walt Disney Company entertains, informs and inspires people around the globe through the power of unparalleled storytelling to create experiences that are both universally and locally cherished. NORTH AMERICA From humble beginnings as a cartoon studio in the 1920s to a preeminent name in the entertainment industry today, we proudly continue our legacy of creating world-class stories and experiences for every member of the family. Our operations in North America span over 10 decades and encompass our three core business segments: Disney Entertainment, ESPN and Disney Experiences. Explore Jobs (North America) LATIN AMERICA We are the leading family entertainment company in Latin America and have been present in the region since the 1940s when Walt Disney himself first traveled to the area to create the company’s sixth animated film “Saludos Amigos.” Today, the business is expansive with offices in Argentina, Brazil, Mexico and the U.S. (Miami) – all working together to enrich people’s lives through storytelling and experiences. Explore Jobs (Latin America) EUROPE, MIDDLE EAST & AFRICA In Europe, Middle East and Africa, we have been creating exceptional entertainment experiences for over 90 years. Through our diverse portfolio of businesses, we focus on delivering our unique brand of world-class storytelling to millions of consumers across more than 130 countries in strategic and locally relevant ways, employing thousands throughout the region. Explore Jobs (Europe, Middle East and Africa) ASIA PACIFIC For more than 70 years, we have been entertaining consumers in Asia Pacific. Today’s consumer can discover new branded experiences in so many ways – from Disney+ to our movies, consumer products, stores, parks, games, books and so much more. Our talented team of employees operates across the Asia-Pacific region, in Australia, New Zealand, Greater China, Japan, Korea and Southeast Asia. Explore Jobs (Asia Pacific) Explore Mainland China Jobs Featuring top honors across industries to exciting announcements from around the world, check out the latest on how we’re leading the way in media, entertainment and experiences. View Recent News OUR BUSINESSES At Disney, our world-class portfolio of brands and businesses work in unison to deliver the creative excellence, innovative technologies, and unforgettable experiences that audiences of all ages have come to cherish for over 100 years. Explore where the next chapter of your career story could begin. Worldwide) Learn more about Disney Publishing Worldwide View all jobs (Disney Store and shopDisney) Learn more about Disney Store and shopDisney OUR CULTURE Our people are at the heart of everything we do here at Disney. They fuel our business, power our storytelling, uphold our strong legacy, and foster good in our communities. We are committed to being a welcoming, respectful, and empowering home to talent from all around the world. Learn More about our culture INCLUSION At Disney, we want everyone to belong and thrive. Creating a welcoming and respectful environment for our employees and guests is core to our company culture and our business. Learn More BENEFITS Because our employees and cast members are at the heart of everything we do, Disney offers a competitive total rewards package that includes pay, health and savings benefits, time-off programs, educational opportunities and more. Learn More COMMUNITY Through financial contributions, collaboration with nonprofit organizations, in-kind donations and employee volunteering, we bring positive, meaningful, and measurable impact to our communities around the world. Learn More Sign Up for Job Alerts Get the latest job opportunities as they become available. Sign Up Notice on Recruitment Scams We have been made aware of recent internet scams involving individuals falsely stating that they are recruiting for positions within The Walt Disney Company asking for personal information and/or money as part of our interview process. Our recruiters will only contact you from an official company email address including: @disney.com, @espn.com, @lucasfilm.com, @ilm.com, @pixar.com or @abc.com. They will not request funds or payment in any form or personal information such as photos of government-issued identification. If you receive a suspicious email, we advise you to mark the email as junk or spam so that your email provider will block them. Close Watch Our Jobs An asterisk indicates a required field. Interested In Select a job category from the list of options. Select a location from the list of options. Finally, click “Add” to create your job alert. More How we use your personal information and your rights: Your personal information is controlled by The Walt Disney Company Limited of 3 Queen Caroline Street, London, W6 9PE, United Kingdom. When you visit or shop with Disney or use any Disney product, service or mobile application, other members of The Walt Disney Company Family of Companies may also use your information to provide you these services, personalise your experience and send you service related updates and communications. You have a number of rights including the right to request access to, change, or remove your personal information, or to change your marketing preferences (including withdrawing your consent at any time.) Please see our Privacy Policy (opens in new window) to learn more about managing your marketing preferences or deleting your account. Our Data Protection Officer can be contacted by emailing: dataprotection@disney.co.uk . You have a right to lodge a complaint with the UK Information Commissioner's Office: https://ico.org.uk/ (opens in new window) . For more information about Disney's data collection and use practices please read Disney's Privacy Policy (opens in new window) . By clicking "Submit", you agree to our Terms of Use (opens in new window) and acknowledge that you have read our Privacy Policy (opens in new window) and Collection Statement (opens in new window) . For more information about our general data collection, use, and practices, including how to manage your preferences, please read our Privacy Policy (opens in new window) . Pavilion About Us Our Team Notice Contact Us Insight About Us Our Team Notice Contact Us Insight OUR TEAM OUR TEAM Founder & Group Chairman Young-Gak (Ken) Yun Chairman, Pavilion Private Equity Seung-Ho Hur Founding Partner & CEO, Pavilion Private Equity Hyung-Jin (Bryan) Park CEO, Pavilion Advisors Young-Joon Hong, CPA (US) Co-Founder & Managing Partner, Pavilion Global Holdings Corp. & Pavilion Private Equity Board Director & Investment Committee Member, Marunouchi Innovation Partners John-Paul P. Yun Managing Director, Pavilion Private Equity Jinhwan Kim Executive Director, Pavilion Private Equity Christopher Won Kang Vice President, Pavilion Private Equity Martin Hyunsub Sim Senior Associate, Pavilion Private Equity Yeomyeong (Paul) Kim Associate, Pavilion Private Equity Sungmin Kim Associate, Pavilion Private Equity Connor Kunwoo Lee Analyst, Pavilion Private Equity Kevin Youngjoon Park Managing Director, Europe/MENA, Pavilion Private Equity Dr. J. Michael Zahrt Ph.D. Global Strategic Advisor, Pavilion Global Holdings Corp. Michael Pitsinos Managing Director, Europe/MENA, Pavilion Private Equity Dr. Ha-Sung (Howard) Chung Ph.D. Young-Gak (Ken) Yun Founder & Group Chairman Mr. Yun, Is Founder and Group Chairman of Pavilion Global Holdings Corp. (“Pavilion”) and Founding Chairman of Pavilion Private Equity, a strategic partnership between Pavilion and Mitsubishi Corporation. He is former Chairman of KTB Private Equity, Founder and former Group Chairman of KPMG Korea (Samjong KPMG), and former member of KPMG International Global Board of Directors. In 1990, Mr. Yun founded Samjong Corporation, which formed a partnership with Houlihan Lokey during the Asian financial crisis to play an active role in the extensive restructuring process of the Korean banking industry. Samjong subsequently became a member firm of KPMG in Korea. Over the span of twenty years of his leadership, Samjong grew into one of the largest professional services firms in Korea, employing over 2,700 professionals with over $300MM in annual revenue. Mr. Yun is the recipient of the Korean government’s “Silver & Bronze Tower Industrial Medal” from the Korean government, being the first recipient from the non-manufacturing sector. In 2009, he was recognized as the “Best Korean CEO” by the Korea Economic Daily Business, as well as one of the “Top 30 Korean Business Leaders” by the MK Economy News.  In 2010, he was awarded the “Talent Management Award” by The Korea Economic Daily. In 2011, Mr. Yun was awarded the “Forbes CSR Award”. In 2011 and 2012, Mr. Yun was selected as one of “The Most Powerful Business Leaders in Korea” by Fortune Magazine. Among his many directorships, advisory, honorary and benevolent activities, Mr. Yun served as the Honorary Consulate of Ukraine and St. Vincent and the Grenadines, member of the Accepting House Committee for the 17th President Myung-Bak Lee, Chairman of the University of Pennsylvania and Duke University Korean Alumni Association, Vice Chairman of the University of Chicago Korean Alumni Association, Board Director of SsangYong Motor Company, Board Director of the Seoul Philharmonic Orchestra, Chairman of The Seoul City Government Sharing Economy Promotion Committee, Senior Advisor of Fosun Group, Board Director of Institute of Global Management (IGM), CEO Professor of Graduate School of Business Ewha Women’s University, Advisory Council Member of Seoul National University Graduate School of Business, Member of the Financial Services Commission ‘Financial Hub Committee’, Member of the Internal  Evaluation Committee of The Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade, Board Director of The UN Global Compact Korea Association, Board Director of The Asia Society Korea, Board Chairman of Enactus Korea, Member of the World Economic Forum Global Agenda Council, Board Director of The Hope Institute, Board Director of Arumjigi Culture Keepers Foundation, Chairman of Pan-Impact Korea, Member of the Far East Asia Economic Development Committee for the Korean government, and Chairman of Seoul South Rotary Club. Mr. Yun is currently Honorary Life Member of the Board of Visitors of Duke Law School, Advisory Board Member of the Duke University Global Capital Markets Center, University of Pennsylvania Asia Leadership Committee Member, Senior Advisor of Barun Law, Board Director of Hanmi Pharmaceutical, Board Director of Sookmyung Women’s University, Chairman & Senior Partner of FRA Korea, Vice Chairman of The Platform For Tomorrow, Chairman of The Asia Future Institute. Mr. Yun has also established and serves as Chairman of the Board of MYSC (Merry Year Social Company), which helps social enterprises with management consulting and funding support. Mr. Yun earned BA in Economics from The University of Pennsylvania, an MBA from The University of Chicago, and a JD and LLM from Duke Law School. Mr. Yun is a certified public accountant and an attorney at law in the State of New York. Seung-Ho Hur Chairman, Pavilion Private Equity Mr. Hur joined Pavilion Private Equity (PPE) in 2023 after an illustrious career in the automotive industry spanning over thirty-five years.  Prior to joining PPE, Mr. Hur served as Chairman of the Board and Executive Vice Chairman & CEO of Daewon Kang Up Co., Ltd., Chairman of Jiangsu Daewon Asia Automobile Spring Co., Ltd., President of Daewon Asia Automotive Science & Technology Co., Ltd., and CEO of ContiTech Daewon Airspring Systems Co., Ltd.  Mr. Hur also served as Board Director of Daewon America, Inc., and Daewon India Autoparts Pvt Ltd. Daewon Kang Up was founded in 1946 by Mr. Hur’s grandfather and has become the leading automotive parts manufacturer supporting the growth of Korea’s automotive and industrial equipment industries. Mr. Hur received a BBA from Seoul National University and an MBA from George Washington University. Mr. Hur is also the recipient of the “Iron Tower Industrial Medal” from the Korean government. Hyung-Jin (Bryan) Park Founding Partner & CEO, Pavilion Private Equity Prior to joining Pavilion Private Equity, Mr. Park served as Senior Managing Director at KTB Private Equity, one of the oldest and largest private equity firms in Korea. He was the Division Head responsible for deal origination, structuring, funding, and portfolio company management.  Prior to joining KTB PE, Mr. Park served as Managing Director at ConneX Partners (current E-Eum Private Equity), a local private equity firm where he was responsible for deal sourcing, structuring, funding and managing three funds totaling $180 million. Mr. Park held various management positions at KPMG, PwC, AT Kearney, and Oliver Wyman. He has specialized in management consulting and PMI (Post Merger Integration) strategy for numerous projects involving financial restructuring. He has also held position at Korea Long Term Credit Bank, conducting treasury trading, fund administration, and credit analysis. Mr. Park received an MBA and a BA in German Literature from Seoul National University. Young-Joon Hong, CPA (US) CEO, Pavilion Advisors Prior to joining Pavilion Private Equity, Mr. Hong served as President for 4 years at The Code F & I, an investment advisory firm providing M & A advisory services. Prior to The Code F & I, Mr. Hong was a Managing Director at Connex Partners (current E-Eum Private Equity), a local middle market private equity firm where he was responsible for structuring, funding, and managing portfolio companies. Mr. Hong held various positions at Daegu Bank and Shinhan Investment Corporation, focusing on syndication and M & A. Mr. Hong spent 7 years at Ernst & Young Korea where he served as Manager of the transaction services M & A advisory team in charge of due diligence and valuation services. Mr. Hong received a BBA from Hanyang University. John-Paul P. Yun Co-Founder & Managing Partner, Pavilion Global Holdings Corp. & Pavilion Private Equity Board Director & Investment Committee Member, Marunouchi Innovation Partners Prior to joining Pavilion, Mr. Yun was a Vice President at PineStreet Group, a Seoul based private investment firm in charge of overseas business and deal origination. Prior to PineStreet, Mr. Yun was a Senior Analyst at Samjong Investment Advisory, the investment advisory arm of KPMG Korea, responsible for origination, fundraising, and  structuring of alternative investment portfolios. Prior to Samjong, Mr. Yun was as an Analyst at Mitsubishi Corporation responsible for North American steel projects and M & A activities in the Tokyo headquarters, and subsequently became an Associate for Mitsubishi International Corporation in New York City, responsible for principal/alternative investments and business development for the North American market. Prior to Mitsubishi, Mr. Yun was as an analyst at The Chart Group, a middle market private equity firm based in New York City. Mr. Yun also serves as Vice Chairman of the Silk Road Chamber of International Commerce Korea Chapter, and Senior Advisor of Afiniti (Korea), a US based AI and data analytics company. Mr. Yun received an MBA from MIT Sloan School of Management-Tsinghua University School of Economics and Management and a BA in International Business and Economics from Sophia University. Mr. Yun is fluent in Korean, English, French, Japanese, and conversant in Mandarin. Seukhoon Paul Choi Partner, Emerging Tech & Defense, Pavilion Global Holdings Corp. S. Paul Choi ( 최석훈 ) helps lead Pavilion’s emerging tech and defense practice and is an expert in defense, international security, and strategic advisory. His extensive background in policy, alliance management, and geopolitical risk uniquely positions Pavilion to capitalize on opportunities within the defense sector, offering a strategic advantage to both investors and portfolio companies. With over 15 years of experience in political-military affairs, international security, and strategy design, Mr. Choi served as an international relations expert at the United Nations Command / Republic of Korea-US Combined Forces Command, where he contributed to strategic initiatives, operational planning, and policy formulation. He has provided counsel to senior executives in finance, industry, government, and the militaries of South Korea, the United States, and other partner countries. At the Council on Foreign Relations and the RAND Corporation, he led research projects focused on evolving security dynamics and alliance management. Mr. Choi served as an officer in the ROK Army and on faculty at the Korea Military Academy. Mr. Choi also serves as Principal of StratWays Group, a Seoul-based strategic advisory that provides guidance on market expansion, business development, and partnerships within both commercial and defense-related sectors. He holds an MA in International Cooperation from Seoul National University and a BA in Philosophy, Politics & Economics from the University of Pennsylvania, with a PhD in War Studies from King’s College London expected in December 2024. Jinhwan Kim Managing Director, Pavilion Private Equity Prior to joining Pavilion Private Equity, Mr. Kim was a Senior Consultant at Ernst & Young Korea, where he has provided transaction advisory services including commercial & financial due diligence, and valuation services. Mr. Kim began his career as an Associate Consultant at Valtech consulting Korea, a branch of the Paris based management consulting firm, where he has conducted numerous corporate strategy consulting projects focusing on cost & performance improvement, commercial excellence, and new business development. Also Mr. Kim has provided BPR (Business Process Reengineering) advisory services to major government organizations, such as Ministry of Justice and Department of Public Health and Welfare. Mr. Kim received a BA in Economics from The University of Vermont. Mr. Kim is fluent in Korean and English. Christopher Won Kang Executive Director, Pavilion Private Equity Prior to joining Pavilion, Mr. Kang served as Investment Manager at Seoul-based real estate investment firm, Mastern Investment Management, where he focused on leading and managing extensive review processes for overseas infrastructure and real estate investment opportunities. Prior to Mastern Investment Management, Mr. Kang was a Manager at Hana Financial Investment, focusing on equity and debt investments for offshore real estate and infrastructure. As part of the Alternative Investment Division at Hana, Mr. Kang successfully closed over $380MN construction loan of hotels and office buildings in New York City. Prior to Hana Financial Investment, Mr. Kang was an Assistant Manager of the Alternative Investment Division at DB Financial Investment where he was responsible for origination, fundraising, and structuring of alternative investment portfolios. Mr. Kang received a BA in Economics from the University of California, Los Angeles (UCLA). He also served as Sergeant of The Republic of Korea Army Special Forces Special Operations Division (“Black Berets”). Mr. Kang is currently a Master Candidate of Energy and Environment Policy from Korea University Graduate School of Energy and Environment. Martin Hyunsub Sim Vice President, Pavilion Private Equity Before joining Pavilion Private Equity, Mr. Sim served as Senior Manager at Simone Investment, a Seoul-based private equity firm.  He was responsible for deal sourcing, fundraising, and managing portfolio companies.  Prior to joining Simone Investment, he worked as a Business Strategy Analyst at TMON where he specialized in setting out business strategies for new ventures.  He also started his career at Vancouver-based asset management firm, Euromerica Investment.  He provided his service as an Analyst for various commodities and assets for the company. He received a BA in Economics from Simon Fraser University, Burnaby Canada. Yeomyeong (Paul) Kim Senior Associate, Pavilion Private Equity Mr. Kim is a distinctive professional with a diverse background in intelligence, international trade, and advanced research in informatics and psycholinguistics. He began his career in public service and foreign trade in his early twenties and quickly distinguished himself through academic excellence and practical contributions to high-level negotiations, generating multimillion-dollar outcomes. He later pursued further education, earning a Master of Public Administration (MPA) from the Seoul National University (SNU) Graduate School of Public Administration. With a strong interest in international law and finance, Mr. Kim has served as a market analyst at Hana Financial Group and as a risk manager at December & Company, an AI-driven robo-advisory firm, before joining Pavilion Private Equity. Mr. Kim’s leadership and achievements have been formally recognized with a commendation from the Mayor of Seoul, underscoring his impact in both the public and private sectors. Sungmin Kim Associate, Pavilion Private Equity Prior to joining Pavilion Private Equity, Mr. Kim was an Assistant Manager at Pavilion Asset Management (current Kyobo AIM Asset Management). Mr. Kim was responsible for a variety of tasks in several divisions, including data center, hedge fund, and real estate finance. Mr. Kim graduated from School of International Liberal Studies, Waseda University. Mr. Kim is fluent in Korean and English. Connor Kunwoo Lee Associate, Pavilion Private Equity Mr. Lee joined Pavilion Private Equity in 2021. He is an Associate of the investment team at the firm. Prior to joining Pavilion, Mr. Lee worked as an investment team intern at Skylake Investment Co. and IMM Investment Corp. based in Seoul. Before that, he worked as an acquisition financing team intern at Yuanta Securities Korea based in Seoul. Mr. Lee received a BA in Economics from Sogang University with the highest honors. Kevin Youngjoon Park Analyst, Pavilion Private Equity Mr. Park joined Pavilion Private Equity in 2023 and now working as an analyst in the investment team. Prior to joining Pavilion, Mr. Park did an  internship at December & Company as a member of alternative investment team. December is an asset management company that manages portfolios through their AI engine. Prior to joining December, Mr. Park did an internship at KIMC, a start-up accelerator company in Hanoi. Dr. J. Michael Zahrt Ph.D. Managing Director, Europe/MENA, Pavilion Private Equity Based in Frankfurt, Dr. Zahrt has broad finance experience and specializes in acting for private equity sponsors, family offices, strategic clients and financial investors on leveraged finance acquisitions and refinancing. Dr. Zahrt´s areas of practice also include acting for corporates on acquisition financings, IPO facilities and general corporate financings. Prior to joining Pavilion, Dr. Zahrt worked for a major German law firm as co-head with a particular industry focus on technology, media and telecommunications. He studied law, Russian and history at Eberhard KarlsUniversity of Tübingen, Philipps University Marburg and at University of St. Gallen Executive School of Management, Technology and Law (ES-HSG). Dr. Zahrt is fluent in German, English, and Russian. Dr. Zahrt is also admitted to the German Bar. Michael Pitsinos Global Strategic Advisor, Pavilion Global Holdings Corp. Michael Pitsinos is an economist and entrepreneur based in New York City. With vast experience in enterprise management, banking, and hospitality, he provides strategic advisory services to investment groups in a broad range of industries including telecommunications, oil, hotel, and F & B. Michael currently serves as the global advisor for Pavilion Global Holdings Corp. headquartered in Seoul, Korea, and is a partner in the Grace Hospitality Group with offices in Los Angeles and New York. Michael previously served the Secretariat of the United Nations in the Department of Public Information, where he reported on the daily activities of the General Assembly and the Security Council. Michael also worked in corporate banking at Citibank and JP Morgan Chase before joining Bareburger, a sustainable and organic restaurant chain with franchises worldwide. Michael holds an MBA and BA. Dr. Ha-Sung (Howard) Chung Ph.D. Managing Director, Europe/MENA, Pavilion Private Equity Prior to joining Pavilion, Dr. Chung was an Attorney¬-at-Law with Freshfields Bruckhaus Deringer, a leading international law firm and founder and CEO of janolawAG, a leading legal technology firm in Germany. Dr. Chung advised multinational companies in M & A and other corporate finance transactions and successfully accompanied high tech startups from set up through growth phase and internationalizing to IPO. Dr. Chung studied philosophy, English literature, German literature, Chinese and law in Berlin, Freiburg and Tübingen, received PhD in law from University Tübingen and is admitted to the German Bar. Dr. Chung is fluent in German, Korean, English, French, and conversant in Mandarin. 이용약관 개인정보처리방침 주소 : 서울특별시 종로구 율곡로 6, A동 15층(중학동, 트윈 트리 빌딩) 이메일 : hsshin@pavilioninv.com Copyright © Pavilion Global Holdings Corp. Who We Are WORLD URBAN PAVILION i n Regent Park Powered by Daniels UN-HABITAT GLOBAL HUB TO EXCHANGE KNOWLDEGE AND INNOVATION Home About us Virtual Pavilion Canada: Frontrunner of Urban SDGs SDG Cities Initiative News Venue Booking Calendar Gallery Contact us World Summit on SDG Cities and Urban Finance The Urban Gala About us Who We Are Who We Are Virtual Pavilion Knowledge Hub Pavilion Talks Virtual Exhibitions Knowledge Hub Pavilion Talks Virtual Exhibitions Canada: Frontrunner of Urban SDGs SDG Cities Initiative News Bayview - 2025-04-26 Rethinking Rental Housing Mitchell Cohen: Book Launch Carlos Moreno: Pavilion Talks Richmond Hill Annoucement UEF & AJF Partnership 100+ Report 1st Year Bayview - 2025-04-26 Rethinking Rental Housing Mitchell Cohen: Book Launch Carlos Moreno: Pavilion Talks Richmond Hill Annoucement UEF & AJF Partnership 100+ Report 1st Year Venue Booking Calendar Gallery Contact us World Summit on SDG Cities and Urban Finance The Urban Gala Who We Are The Pavilion is governed by an International Board (IB) , Steering Committee (SC) and CO-Directors . The IB helps to build the Pavilion's global reach through advocacy and identifying innovative and transformative approaches to sustainable urbanization. The SC provides strategic guidance on the Pavilion's programming and structure. Both bodies have an important role to support the Pavilion as a global knowledge exchange hub. The visioning and executing the day-to-day activities are led a Secretariat . International Board Hon.
